-1.title: Who's Carrying Off the Carrots?
-1.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: Cloud Bread/Shadow Tag/Mom's Lipstick
1.plot: Mom Cat makes the very first cloud bread. Hongbi and Hongshi help Wooli find his shadow. Hongbi dreams of what it's like to be a grown up, like her mother.

2.title: A Present from Heaven/Hongshi's Bank Book/Mothers Know Best
2.plot: Hongbi and Hongshi plant seeds in vases made of cloud bread dough. Hongshi learns about saving money. Hongshi gets into mischief because he doesn't listen.

3.title: Our New Friend Boo/The Moms' Picnic/The Old Magician Lady
3.plot: The kids are afraid of a newcomer at first, but he becomes a friend. The village Moms take a baking lesson from Mrs. Cat and learn to be like kids again. Hongbi and Hongshi help a lady magician.

4.title: The Flea Market/The Day the Laundry Blew Away/Book Doctors
4.plot: Hongbi's class holds a flea market to raise funds for a new fire alarm system. Hongshi worries about a laundry-eating monster. In a dream land of picture books, Hongbi and Hongshi meet Mori, Hongshi's toy bear.

5.title: My Uncle Kook/The New Baby/Flying Chicks
5.plot: Uncle Kook helps Grandpa with the grape harvest. Hongshi is jealous of the baby his family is baby-sitting. Hongbi and Hongshi visit Grandpa's farm. Some baby chicks get into the cloud bread and fly away.

6.title: Guilty Wooli/Popcorn Stars/Dancing with Grandpa
6.plot: Wooli fibs about why his homework isn't done and feels guilty about it. Hongbi, Hongshi and their friends learn how to make popcorn from Uncle Kook. Hongbi and Hongshi learn to tap dance from their Grandpa.

7.title: Flowers for a Tiger/The Old Phone/Everyday is my Birthday
7.plot: During the village Flower Festival, all the kids are afraid to take flowers to Mr. Tiger's house. Hongbi and Hongshi find a mysterious old phone in Grandpa's attic. Hongshi is jealous of Hongbi's birthday party.

8.title: Superhero in the Neighborhood/New Kid in the Neighborhood/The Expensive Antique
8.plot: Hongshi's mischievous classmate, Nunu, is invited to fly along as they complete their errands; now he thinks he's a superhero. Hongbi and Hongshi meet Toto, their neighbor's nephew - a talented, but unhappy sculptor. Ruis gets angry when Hongshi accidentally breaks an old teapot.

9.title: Feeding the Fish/New Teeth/Brand New Names for Everything
9.plot: The family has a picnic by the lake and the kids feed the fish cloud bread. Hongshi helps the Tooth Fairy finish his rounds, delivering new teeth to kids. Hongshi and his friends try to come up with dictionary of new names for everything.

10.title: Mom's Basket/The Smallest Garden in the World/Blowing Bubbles
10.plot: Mom Cat asks the kids to deliver a basket of bread to Grandpa. They help others in their village along the way. Mr. Giraffe, a musician shows the village kids how to make a hat garden. Hongbi and Hongshi help the Bubble Man have a great bubble show.

11.title: I Like My Teacher Best/Growing Bread/Night Worries
11.plot: Hongbi accidentally breaks a vase and then is worried that Teacher Elli is upset with her. Hongshi doesn't want to eat any vegetables until Uncle Kook tells him about "Growing Bread." Hongshi wets his bed one night and Mori, his toy bear takes him to the Land of Boo-boos.

12.title: The Kite/Star Seeds/Mom & Dad's Anniversary
12.plot: Dad takes the kids to fly kites at the beach. One night Hongbi, Hongshi, Mom and Dad go for a walk and see a shooting star. Hongbi, Hongshi and Uncle Kook help Mom and Dad celebrate their anniversary.

13.title: Dinosaur Hunt/The Room Cleaning/Dancing with Mom & Dad
13.plot: The kids dig for buried treasure with Uncle Kook and find the fossil of a dinosaur bone. Mom warns Hongshi about his messy room and the Toy Fairy, who takes toys from kids who don't clean up. Hongshi struggles with dancing at school. Mom and Dad help him learn to have fun dancing.

14.title: I Want to be a Star/The Magic Card/Cooking with Dad
14.plot: Hongshi is disappointed when he gets the part of a butterfly in the class play. Hongbi, Hongshi and Mori follow Grandpa in a dream. When Dad is in charge of the kids one day, he decides to bake bread for a snack.

15.title: The Snow Balloon/The Skating Party/The Christmas Present
15.plot: Hongbi and Hongshi try to return a balloon to its owner. Hongshi learns to ice skate from Dad and Hongbi. Christmas Eve night, Santa arrives - on foot. All the reindeer are sick, so he had to walk.

16.title: The Puzzle Map/The Secret Friend Game/Mom is the Best Cook
16.plot: Hongbi and her friends decide to make a map of the village. In Hongshi's class, everyone plays a Secret Friend game. Mom Cat has famous food critics come by to taste her cooking.

17.title: The Reading Tree/Rainbow Milk/Pet Day
17.plot: Grandma Dorothy tells the kids about the Reading Tree. Hongbi and Hongshi spend the day with Grandpa and learn about Rainbow Milk. Hongshi finds a spider for the class pet talent show.

18.title: The Blackout/Lucky Chocolate Necklace/The Talking Stick
18.plot: The family helps Hongshi overcome his fears during a blackout. Hongshi wins a chocolate necklace, but doesn't want to share it. Grandma Dorothy lends the kids her 'talking stick' to learn to take turns.

19.title: Cloud Trouble/Grandma's Bean Soup/I Want to go to the Party!
19.plot: Mom makes cloud bread from a little thunder cloud the kids found, with interesting results. Grandma Dorothy tells a story about making a whole kettle of soup from a single bean. Wooli thinks the kids are having a party without him.

20.title: Bring on the Clouds/Following Boo/Our Dad is Number One
20.plot: One hot day, Hongbi and Hongshi go searching for clouds, in hopes of rain. Boo is the object of hero-worship when he stops a couple of playground bullies. The village has a sports contest and Hongshi helps his father to win the last race.

21.title: The Letter/Hongbi & Hongshi's Delivery/The Case of the Missing Fridge
21.plot: Boo hurts Hongbi's feelings and tries to apologize in a letter. Hongbi and Hongshi help an injured neighbor deliver her flowers. The refrigerator goes missing and the kids go searching for it.

22.title: Crying Cloud Bread/Let's Go Camping/Imagine That!
22.plot: One day, Mom Cat bakes cloud bread using a small rain cloud. The kids go camping in the backyard and Mom tells about the Campground Ghost. Reading fairy tales upsets Boo, because the giant is always the bad guy.

23.title: Toy Shop Sweep/Hongshi's Many Dreams/What Should I Collect?
23.plot: The kids of the village join in a Toy Shopping Spree, held by Mr. Raccoon. Hongshi thinks about what he wants to be when he grows up. Hongbi admires all her friends' collections, but wonders what she should collect.

24.title: The Riddle Contest/Cookie's Bakery/Hongshi is a Tattletale
24.plot: Hongbi and Hongshi have a riddle contest with the family. Hongbi and Hongshi help Cookie and his mother promote the bakery. Hongshi becomes a tattletale.

25.title: Dad's Fairy Tale Book/New Mittens/My Sister's Cold
25.plot: The kids go with Mori, the toy bear and help Pinocchio to find the boy who never finished reading his story. Hongbi's mittens float away when she stuffs them with cloud bread. Hongbi gets a fever and Hongshi goes to find ice for her.

26.title: Hiccup Trouble/Returning Baby Turtle Home/A Special Calendar
26.plot: Hongbi gets a case of the hiccups just before her school sings in the Song Festival. Hongbi, Hongshi and Grandpa save a baby turtle. Hongbi shows Hongshi the special calendar she's made from the events in her journal.

imdb.plot outline: This animated series is about two kittens, 7 year old Hongbi and her 5 year old brother, Hongshi. The series follows their adventures which include the kittens and their friends, Wooli, Ruis, Boo, Cookie, Mimi and Ed. Learning the importance of practice and patience, being kind to others, performing in a school play when one has hiccups and dealing with jealousy about a new baby are among the story themes of the show. Based in part on characters from the children's book by Baek Hee Na.
imdb.title: Cloud Bread
plot: Two kittens, Hongbi and Hongshi find a cloud stuck in a tree. They take it to their mother. She mixes the cloud into some bread dough and adds "...a kiss of mother's love." To their wonderment, when eat the bread, they can fly.::Sylvia Edwards
